alert.note: Alert for Fairfield; Kershaw; Richland (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 5:36PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Fairfield, northeastern Richland and southwestern Kershaw Counties through 615 PM EDT... At 535 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms near Springdale, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Columbia, Forest Acres, Camden, Lake Wateree Dam, Dentsville, Arcadia Lakes, Lugoff, Fairfield County Airport, Villages at Sandhill, Elgin, Horrel Hill, Killian, Woodfield, Sesquicentennial State Park, Lake Carolina, Longtown, Fort Jackson, Goodale State Park, Blythewood and Ridgeway. This includes the following highways... Interstate 20 in South Carolina between mile markers 71 and 98. Interstate 77 between mile markers 13 and 42. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
